Class QMTextbox

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • QMTextbox
  • public class QMTextbox
extends greenfoot.Actor
    A container to display one or multiple lines of text. The textbox is a rectangular shape which contains text within it.
    Version:
    6/12/2021
    Author:
    Quinton Mak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      QMTextbox​(String[] textArray, int width, int height, greenfoot.Color backgroundColor)
      Displays multiple lines of text left justified, in default Greenfoot font (size 14 Sans Serif black text).

      Displays multiple lines of text left justified, allowing the user to select the width and height of the textbox, background color, text color, border color and the font.

      Displays a string at the top left corner of the textbox, allowing the user to select the width, height, background color, text color, border color, font, and text offsets.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String text,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor)
        Displays a string at the top left corner of the box in default Greenfoot font (size 14 Sans Serif black text). Users may select the background color and the width and height of the textbox.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is 6 pixels from the left edge of the textbox and 3 pixels from the top of the textbox.

        Parameters:
        text - The string that is to be displayed
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String text,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor)
        Displays a string at the top left corner of the box in default font of a certain color with a certain background color. Users may select the width and height of the textbox, background color, and text color.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is offset 6 units right and 3 units down.

        Parameters:
        text - The string that is to be displayed
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String text,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor,
                 greenfoot.Color borderColor)
        Displays a string at the top left corner of the box in default font of a certain text color, background color and border color. Users may select the width and height of the textbox, background color, text color, and border color.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is offset 6 units right and 3 units down.

        Parameters:
        text - The string that is to be displayed
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The color of the textbox's border - passing null will make no border

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String text,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor,
                 greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                 greenfoot.Font font)
        Displays a string at the top left corner of the box of a certain text color, background color and border color. Users may select the width and height of the textbox, background color, text color, border color and the font.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is offset 6 units right and 3 units down.

        Parameters:
        text - The string that is to be displayed
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The color of the textbox's border - passing null will make no border
        font - The font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font (Sans Serif size 14)

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String text,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor,
                 greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                 greenfoot.Font font,
                 int xOffset,
                 int yOffset)
        Displays a string at the top left corner of the textbox, allowing the user to select the width, height, background color, text color, border color, font, and text offsets.
        Parameters:
        text - The string that is to be displayed
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The color of the textbox's border - passing null will make no border
        font - The font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font
        xOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the left edge of the textbox (greater than 0)
        yOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the top of the textbox (greater than 0)

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String[] textArray,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor)
        Displays multiple lines of text left justified, in default Greenfoot font (size 14 Sans Serif black text). Users may select the width and height of the textbox and the background color.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is 6 pixels from the left edge of the textbox and 3 pixels from the top of the textbox.

        Parameters:
        textArray - An array of strings, with each element being a new line of text.
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String[] textArray,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor)
        Displays multiple lines of text left justified in default Greenfoot font. Users may select the width and height of the textbox, background color, and text color.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is offset 6 units right and 3 units down.

        Parameters:
        textArray - An array of strings, with each element being a new line of text.
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String[] textArray,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor,
                 greenfoot.Color borderColor)
        Displays multiple lines of text left justified in default Greenfoot font. Users may select the width and height of the textbox, background color, text color, and border color.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is offset 6 units right and 3 units down.

        Parameters:
        textArray - An array of strings, with each element being a new line of text.
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The color of the textbox's border - passing null will make no border

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String[] textArray,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor,
                 greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                 greenfoot.Font font)
        Displays multiple lines of text left justified, allowing the user to select the width and height of the textbox, background color, text color, border color and the font.

        By default, the top left corner of the text is offset 6 units right and 3 units down.

        Parameters:
        text - The string that is to be displayed
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The color of the textbox's border - passing null will make no border
        font - The font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font (Sans Serif size 14)

      • QMTextbox

        public QMTextbox​(String[] textArray,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                 greenfoot.Color textColor,
                 greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                 greenfoot.Font font,
                 int xOffset,
                 int yOffset)
        Displays multiple lines of text left justified, allowing the user to select the width, height, background color, text color, border color, font, and text offsets.
        Parameters:
        textArray - An array of strings, with each element being a new line of text.
        width - The width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        backgroundColor - The background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The color of the text - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The color of the textbox's border - passing null will make no border
        font - The font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font
        xOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the left edge of the textbox (greater than 0)
        yOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the top of the textbox (greater than 0)

                   greenfoot.Font font)
        Changes the font and the text color
        Parameters:
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font

                   greenfoot.Color textColor,

        Parameters:
        backgroundColor - The new background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The new border color - passing null will make no border

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText)
        Completely replaces the current text in the box, keeping all other properties the same
        Parameters:
        updateText - The new string that is to be displayed.

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font)
        Completely replaces the current text in the box. Allows the user to update the text's font and color
        Parameters:
        updateText - The new string that is to be displayed.
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font)
        Completely replaces the current text in the box. Allows the user to update the width and height, font, and text color
        Parameters:
        updateText - The new string that is to be displayed.
        width - The new width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The new height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font,
                   int xOffset,
                   int yOffset)
        Completely replaces the current text in the box.

        Allows the user to update the width, height, background color, text color, border color, font, and text offsets

        Parameters:
        updateText - The new string that is to be displayed
        width - The new width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The new height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        backgroundColor - The new background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The new border color - passing null will make no border
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font
        xOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the left edge of the textbox (greater than 0)
        yOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the top of the textbox (greater than 0)

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText,
                   int lineNum)
        Completely replaces one line of text, keeping all other properties the same
        Parameters:
        updateText - The new text to be displayed
        lineNum - The line of text to be changed. lineNum = 1 is the first line. Should be between 1 and the total number of lines in the textbox

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText,
                   int lineNum,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font)
        Completely replaces one line of text. Allows the user to update the font and text color. Only one line can have a changed fibt at any given time.
        Parameters:
        updateText - The new text to be displayed
        lineNum - The line of text to be changed. lineNum = 1 is the first line. Should be between 1 and the total number of lines in the textbox
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText,
                   int lineNum,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font)
        Completely replaces one line of text. Allows the user to update the width, height, font and text color.
        Parameters:
        updateText - The new text to be displayed
        lineNum - The line of text to be changed. lineNum = 1 is the first line. Should be between 1 and the total number of lines in the textbox
        width - The new width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The new height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font

      • update

        public void update​(String updateText,
                   int lineNum,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font,
                   int xOffset,
                   int yOffset)
        Completely replaces one line of text.

        Allows the user to update the width, height, background color, text color, border color, font, and text offsets

        Parameters:
        updateText - The new string that is to be displayed
        lineNum - The line of text to be changed. lineNum = 1 is the first line. Should be between 1 and the total number of lines in the textbox
        width - The new width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The new height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        backgroundColor - The new background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The new border color - passing null will make no border
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font
        xOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the left edge of the textbox (greater than 0)
        yOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the top of the textbox (greater than 0)

      • update

        public void update​(String[] updateArray)
        Completely replaces all lines of text, keeping all other properties the same
        Parameters:
        updateArray - An array of strings, which is the new text to be displayed, with each element being a new line of text.

      • update

        public void update​(String[] updateArray,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font)
        Completely replaces all lines of text. Allows the user to update the font and text color.
        Parameters:
        updateArray - An array of strings, which is the new text to be displayed, with each element being a new line of text.
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font

      • update

        public void update​(String[] updateArray,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font)
        Completely replaces all lines of text. Allows the user to update the width, height, font, and text color
        Parameters:
        updateArray - An array of strings, which is the new text to be displayed, with each element being a new line of text.
        width - The new width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The new height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font

      • update

        public void update​(String[] updateArray,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   greenfoot.Color backgroundColor,
                   greenfoot.Color textColor,
                   greenfoot.Color borderColor,
                   greenfoot.Font font,
                   int xOffset,
                   int yOffset)
        Completely replaces all lines of text.

        Allows the user to update the width, height, background color, text color, border color, font, and text offsets

        Parameters:
        updateArray - An array of strings, which is the new text to be displayed, with each element being a new line of text.
        width - The new width of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        height - The new height of the textbox, in pixels (greater than 0)
        backgroundColor - The new background color of the textbox - passing null will set this to transparent
        textColor - The new text color - passing null will set this to black
        borderColor - The new border color - passing null will make no border
        font - The new font of the text - passing null will set this to the default font
        xOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the left edge of the textbox (greater than 0)
        yOffset - The number of pixels the top left corner of the text is positioned from the top of the textbox (greater than 0)

        public String[] getText()
        Gets the text currently displayed in the textbox
